exercises.question: What does the 'Data Minimisation' principle mean under GDPR?
options: Keeping data for a minimum of 10 years.
Collecting only the data that is absolutely necessary for the specific purpose.
Making the font size smaller on privacy documents.
Using as few servers as possible to store data.

exercises.title: Breach Notification Email (Internal)
exercises.description: You discovered that a spreadsheet containing customer email addresses was accidentally shared with an external vendor. Write a notification email to your Data Protection Officer (DPO). Use a neutral tone and at least one complex passive structure.
exercises.sampleAnswer:
Subject: Notification of potential data breach - [Date]

Dear DPO,

I am writing to report a security incident involving the accidental disclosure of customer data. 

Earlier today, it was discovered that a spreadsheet containing approximately 200 customer email addresses was sent to an external vendor as part of a routine request. It is believed that this occurred due to an error in the file attachment process. 

We have already contacted the vendor to request the immediate deletion of the file, and they have confirmed receipt of this request. At this stage, it is thought that the risk to the individuals affected is low, as no financial data or passwords were included. 

I am available to provide further details as you assess whether formal notification to the regulator is required.

Best regards,

[Your Name]
